title: We kept them flying
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Dept. of Planning and Community Development, partner

Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Women in war
abstract: "We became one big happy family, sharing, lending, comforting and helping each other in times of distress."
description: On the way home from enrolling in the Women's Australian Auxiliary Air Force (WAAAF) in 1941, Maude Coates learnt that the Japanese forces had just bombed Darwin. For almost 4 years, Coates worked hard and built a great sense of companionship with the other women she lived and worked with.  Serving time in the Women's Forces out of duty, Maude feels proud to have served her country and been part of history.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002737; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [St Arnaud Veterans]; Active; 2011
